reference.title: Canon USB APIs
reference.shortdesc: Canon provides an application programming interface (API) to enable software developers to access images stored on the SD card to and to control camera functions.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: The Canon USB APIs enable you to perform the following functions with 3rd party software when the camera is attached to a computer with a USB inteface.

li.p: Fetch a range of thumbnail images
Control camera functions for remote shooting

section.p: The APIs are especially useful for enabling tethered shooting. The following sections document the various APIs.

section.title: USBFetchImage
section.p: Fetch an image by name or by sequence number on the SD card.

row.entry: A string giving the full image name. If not null, indicates that you are requesting a named image. If null, indicates you are requesting an image by sequence.
An integer indicating the position on the SD card of the image to retrieve. If zero, retrieves the next image on the card.

example.title: Retrieving Images in Sequence
example.p: The example demonstrates how to retrieve images in sequence starting from the first image on the card.

example.title: Retrieving a Named Image
example.p: This example demonstrates how to retrieve an image by name.
